meanings.sent1: After the war, the country decided to reannexing the territories it had lost.
meanings.sent2: The city council voted on reannexing the neighboring town into its jurisdiction.
meanings.sent3: The mayor joked that he was reannexing all the cookies in the jar for himself.
meanings.sent4: The teacher felt like reannexing the students' attention after a long break.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was reannexing the overgrown garden back into a beautiful space.

meanings.sent1: The reannexing of the disputed land caused tension between the two countries.
meanings.sent2: Historians studied the reannexing of territories by ancient empires.
meanings.sent3: The reannexing of the missing puzzle piece completed the picture.
meanings.sent4: The reannexing of the old building into the new development was a controversial decision.
meanings.sent5: The reannexing of the lost files saved the project from failure.

meanings.sent1: The reannexing of the province brought stability to the region.
meanings.sent2: Citizens celebrated the reannexing of their town into the larger city.
meanings.sent3: The reannexing of the stolen artifact to the museum was a triumph.
meanings.sent4: The reannexing of the separated families brought tears of joy.
meanings.sent5: The reannexing of the lost memories filled her with nostalgia.
